page.title: 08THE EPSOM DERBY
page.content:
{Epsom}is synonymous with the{Derby,} most important of the five annual flat horse-racing{"Classics".}This was first run in 1780,and is now one of the country's leading sporting events. It is run in June, over a mile and a half of the{Epsom Downs course,}which features the famous{Tattenham Corner} turn. (The{Oaks,}another Classic,is run on the same course a few days later). The{Derby}is always attended by Royalty,and attracts huge crowds who gather around the imposing{Grand- {stand.}Controversially,new fencing has been introduced to prevent the traditional{free view}of the race.
Here are some{children's impressions of the scene on the morning of the big race,after having walked around the fair and the open market;and having met some of the large,friendly crowd.
